TextView.android:text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who has been at the helm of India's government since 2014, is known for his dynamic leadership and ambitious vision for the country. Modi's tenure has been marked by a range of significant initiatives aimed at transforming India's economic landscape and boosting its global standing. Key among these initiatives are the campaign, which seeks to turn India into a global manufacturing hub, and which aims to enhance the country's digital infrastructure and connectivity. Under Modi's leadership, India has seen substantial developments in infrastructure, including the construction of highways, railways, and urban development projects. His government has also focused on financial inclusion through schemes like Jan Dhan Yojana, which has brought millions of unbanked citizens into the formal banking system. Modi's foreign policy has been characterized by a proactive and assertive stance, seeking to strengthen ties with major global powers while also engaging with neighboring countries. His government has actively worked to enhance India's security apparatus, addressing both traditional and non-traditional security challenges. Despite these achievements, Modi's tenure has not been without controversy. His government has faced criticism over issues such as the handling of the COVID-19 pandemic, economic challenges, and social policies.
